website_summaries.verdict: Sticking with a tried and trusted design, these basic finger pinch guards get the job done and are loved equally by parents and pet owners.
pros: EVA foam construction combined with a simple "C" shape does its job and couldn't be easier to install
Works on both the tops and sides of doors
Comes with a lifetime money back guarantee
cons: Some users complained of a chemical odor

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a month ago for a specific door in our house. I figured the 6 pack was reasonable even though we only needed one because we might need more later. After a month, we're already on our third pinch guard because the first two broke. They must be flimsy, because I'm pretty sure our door frame isn't made of knives. They just tear apart!
customer_reviews.author: NWgirl

customer_reviews.title: These are VERY fragile
customer_reviews.text: This is a great concept, executed horribly. These fell apart on first use with my toddlers. They would try to slam the door and these would essentially crumble. I do NOT recommend this product. I have started putting a towel up there and it hold up as these do not.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Essential safety precaution for lil fingers
customer_reviews.text: I almost lost the top of my finger in a door when I was a kid. I needed a hand specialist and surgery and was lucky that it eventually healed so for me these simple little foam pieces are a godsend as my daughter has to open and close every door in whatever room she happens to be in. It’s a snug fit so they don’t fall off, they’re soft so they don’t scratch the door or the frame, and they’re thick enough so the door can’t be forced shut.
customer_reviews.author: Clare S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my cats! Safe!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to prevent my cats from getting hurt since they love sticking their paws in between doors. I actually ended up placing these on the metal hinges between the door and the wall. They worked really well since the doors definitely can’t close on them with those in the way! This also helps by making sure my dog doesn’t lock himself in rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Mj123

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter Loved Them!
customer_reviews.text: These were not for me. They were for my daughter. She has a cat that is always getting locked in rooms because he loves to push the doors shut. Now, this prevents her cat from doing that. He doesn't understand why, but it has solved her problem! Thank you for making these. Years ago, I used something similar when my grandchildren were little to prevent them from accidentally locking themselves in various rooms. My daughter remembered this and said she needed to find something like them for her cat. I found these and knew right away they would work. They have made her a very happy cat mommy!
customer_reviews.author: Marsha J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use Foam Door Guards
customer_reviews.text: These door pinch guards keep tiny fingers safe quickly & easily! No scratches or holes in your woodwork either. They also work to keep the little ones from accidentally getting shut inside a room or closet. I use one on the cellar door in tandem with a strap that allows the cats to get to their litter box but keeps my granddaughter from tumbling down the stairs. I highly recommend these versatile & economical door guards!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila A. Shanahan

customer_reviews.title: She isn't the brightest cat but I love her.
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats. Evil, naughty, stupid at times cats. One cat loves closing doors which is usually not a big deal until no one is home to let her out. I have door stoppers on a couple doors but my bedroom door I like to be able to close at will. This little thing fit the bill. It slides on and off of the door when needed and leaves a good gap if the door is pushed closed so it doesn't latch. Several came in the pack but I'm currently only using 2 and with as durable as they seem I'll have spare ones for a good long while.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised! When a baby gets mobile and ...
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised! When a baby gets mobile and discovers moving doors, these become very important. Word to the wise- when these are in place, depending on how your door is hung there may be no gap on the hinge side. So, a child could still pinch their fingers on the hinge side if they pushed the door from that end. That's not the fault of this product design though; it's your door. Our doors are white so these also blend right in. We put them up near the top of the door so we don't even notice them.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the little door slammers!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these!!! My daughter loves to try to shut or slam doors closed and I was worried she’d get her fingers in the doors. These are amazing and quite resilient to repeated attempts to slam the doors, and even to my daughter trying to tear them with her teeth when she got ahold of one I left sitting out. They stay put on the side or on the top of the door. They recommend using them on top as it stops the door sooner, but I am short and struggle to reach the top of the door. I use mine on the side as high as I can above the knob and they’ve worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Linnea Wright

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic idea!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these! I saw them at a friend's house and ordered them right away! Such peace of mind knowing my son can practice independence in baby-proofed rooms without worrying about the doors! Any room he's allowed in "alone" has one. They're so easy to put on and take off so we can change the doors he can use based on where the adults are. I use them on closet doors as well!
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth H.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps doors from jamming on little hands and fingers
customer_reviews.text: Second time ordering these for our heavy garage door and extremely pleased! They are light and do the job of keeping a door from slamming on our toddlers fingers. I’ve ordered plastic ones and they do not work properly. These foam ones don’t last forever but that is why you get 6 in a pack. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Roth

customer_reviews.title: FINGER SAVERS!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these things! They are a definite finger saver. I watch my 2 year old grandsons through the week and they can get very rowdy. Running around chasing each other.......slamming doors. I tried using pool noodles at first (cutting sections off and making a slice in them to fit them on the door) but one of the boys loves to slam the door and they kept breaking off. So I bought these. They are perfect! No more worries for me. I, definitely, recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: agwalker

customer_reviews.title: Door pinch....happy pets!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these for keeping a door from closing completely so our kitty cat could get to her litter box easily and yet the door would be mostly closed so we or visitors were not viewing or smelling any possible odors. It's a perfect little item for this and would be great with dogs & small children. Another big plus! Using these you can put them at the top of a door so dogs or children cannot reach them & take them out, along the top of a door allows you to adjust the opening you want. Great Item!!! LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Such a simple and convenient solution!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect to protect our one year old from jamming his fingers with the door! These are very soft and don't damage the door, simple to slide on and off, yet snug enough that they won't fall off on their own. When not in used, we just hang them on the handle, so we don't have to look for it when we need it. With the guard on, you can almost close the door with about an inch of space left. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Elena S

customer_reviews.title: Worked Exactly as Promised
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased similar pinch guards over a decade ago when my son was a baby...and we loved them not only for baby safety, but also to ensure that the cats never got locked into a room inadvertently. Now, years later, we realized we really needed new ones to continue to give the cats access to rooms without worrying about the door accidentally shutting behind them. These guards are perfect. Easy to pop onto any door and fit snuggly so you can use on the side of the door (not just on the top). THANKS!
customer_reviews.author: JuliaDance

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my son decided he loved playing with doors, opening and closing them constantly and I was worried he was going to hurt his fingers since sometimes he was pretty close to closing the doors on them himself. He still tries to close the doors but I haven't worried even in the slightest since we got these. He attempts to slam the doors and his fingers are still safe. Highly recommend buying these for some peace of mind if you have a little one that loves slamming doors.
customer_reviews.author: The Chetu

customer_reviews.title: TAIL SAVER!
customer_reviews.text: My dog's tail was broken when my 3 year old grandson slammed it in a door - don't worry, doggy is ok, it didn't slam too hard and could have been much worse- so the vet suggested these things- they are AMAZING and prevent all sorts of accidents to my fur babies and grand baby! They stay in place nicely and are a good value. You could do the same thing with a cut up pool noodle, but these look much nicer! !!!
customer_reviews.author: luvsamazn

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed. Our toddlers new favorite pass time is slamming doors! I wince everytime she gets to one before I do, worried about her little fingers. Much to her frustration the pinch guards work perfectly even on our heavy front door. Also great for windy days. When you don't want the guard in place just hang it over a door knob for storage. Great buy, arrived quickly, exactly as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lynn Bricen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: These work great for protecting little ones from pinching their fingers in the door. Also works great for my cat who is notorious for shutting himself inside a room! I wish they were made of something a little sturdier than the foam as my pets tear them up if they get ahold of one!
customer_reviews.author: EKM

customer_reviews.title: Will break easily
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last long, broke as kids closed the door. Bought from a different seller two years ago and those lasted for two years. This wasn't a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Simple solution to door propping
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I did not purchase these for a child. I use them to assist with keeping dorm room doors open during the cleaning process. Doors have self close and latch. This would require the use of a badge swipe & key in pin to open. During the summer, while students have vacated - we repair & clean the vacant units. These door props are a much better alternative to a traditional "wedge" style door prop and way more efficient then having to swipe & enter pin over and over again during the multiple trips in/out of each room by multiple staff.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Hulshart

customer_reviews.title: No more doors slamming from open windows
customer_reviews.text: Our baby is not old enough to get fingers stuck in doors yet, but she HAS been awakened by doors slamming because we like to keep the windows open. I stuck this near the top of the door and tried to slam it shut myself, but it just gives off a very muffled "thud". Needless to say I'll be making sure these are on the doors at all times this summmer.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Great protection for little fingers
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what it’s suppose to do. Easy to install, remove and use! No more slamming doors for my little one and have a possible finger smash accident! These are great for little ones who are just learning to open and close doors! This will prevent them from smashing their little finger! 6 in a pack for a great price! Can’t beat that!
customer_reviews.author: mheartsn

customer_reviews.title: Great, cheap, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I was going out of town and needed a way to keep the doors in my house open since I have a cat who loves to close doors. These turned out great. They were cheap, easy to put on the door, and easy to take off. I just left them up so I never have to worry about it. The best door stopper I've had.
customer_reviews.author: DLL

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after the second time having to climb in through the bedroom window. I have a 2 year old daughter who enjoys locking herself inside rooms and wont open the door until she feels like it. This product does its job. And no more window climbing for me. I really love this product and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Erika C.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for the door leading to my basement so the cats could always have access to their litter boxes down there. Now no one can accidentally shut the door and lock them out. I tried a cute door stopper but it didn't fit underneath the door so this seemed like a reliable solution. Probably better than a door stopper because I can easily open and close (well almost) the door.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict0509

customer_reviews.title: Great door bumpers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as replacements for our 16 year-old ones. They hold on to the doors very nicely (our old ones constantly fall off). I will say that they are very solid foam and not soft like the title suggests. And fyi... They are a great way to keep the doors from shutting - so our dogs can easily go through the house without getting stuck in a room.
customer_reviews.author: beckwa

customer_reviews.title: helps quiet door slamming
customer_reviews.text: i am very sensitive and hate when doors slam. these are light weight and easy to carry with me. they are economical and super easy to use! loud door slams can be damaging to children and pets sensitive ears. glad i got them. its other purpose is to use as a pinch guard for children's little hands. i also notice the benefit of pets not being able to get through the narrow opening it provides by letting the door stay slightly open, while letting pets look into the room.
customer_reviews.author: E. Middleton Doegey

customer_reviews.title: Must Purchase
customer_reviews.text: These are a game changer, defiantly should purchase if you have kids or pets. They aren’t stylish, being that they are white though the don’t stand out too much as they match doors. Work as designed and have kept fingers from getting squished and pets from getting locked in a room. Have referrerd them to others and I’m sure I will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Invention!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased to find these as they were exactly what I was imagining I wanted. I have cats and dogs who are constantly coming in and out the door. These allow me to keep the door slightly cracked so they can come in. Now I just wish I could teach them how to close the door back again!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy L. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Does job, but not for long
customer_reviews.text: If you have a strong toddler who loves slamming doors, these puppies will not last long. After about a week of slamming the door with this foam donut on, the guard split in two. The other guards with less slamming all have dents in them where they will split in the future. Good product in theory or for a less rambunctious child.
customer_reviews.author: Crysela

customer_reviews.title: One talented cat
customer_reviews.text: My daughter uses these to protect her two boys from injury. I use them on doors that our male cat likes to close and then finds himself locked in! He won't cry for help; just sits there in faith that I will eventually rescue him. After a couple days, you don't even notice them on our white doors. Easy to remove when I need to close a door.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Works without a clunk.
customer_reviews.text: This product is super. It can be place high on the door so the little ones can't mess with it. Soft so it does not make a sound when door is shut. Easily removed when door needs to be shut all the way. Just what we needed. We it because the cats don't like doors shut but we need to keep out light. They are able to get in when they want. Only problem...The guards do not reshut the door! LOL Great product.
customer_reviews.author: CloENote

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids who get into the "Slam Door Phase." Worked on all doors in our home. The foam is durable yet soft enough its not going to hurt the door or door frame. Self explanatory for the most part. Also protects little fingers from getting smashed.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: When my 2.5 year old tried to Sam the door on me and it bounced back..... Priceless
customer_reviews.author: Krystina Carrino

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: So easy. My toddlers think it’s so much fun to slam doors and fingers we’re getting caught if I couldn’t get there fast enough to stop them. This prevents them from getting the door where they can pinch their fingers. Slide them on the door, slide off when you want it closed
customer_reviews.author: Robbi

customer_reviews.title: Economical and practical.
customer_reviews.text: We use these to keep classroom doors locked and propped — no fumbling with keys in a lockdown. Very economical. Occasionally they “ disappear,” and I always have an inexpensive backup. Fun to decorate with paint pens, too.
customer_reviews.author: Miss_Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Baby proof glass shower door
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for baby proofing glass shower doors that swing in both directions and are super heavy/sharp. Easy to use without damaging or adding adhesive to anything. Nightmare waiting to happen with little fingers and those doors, yikes. So thankful for a simple solution!
customer_reviews.author: loloschneider

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this one for about a month now. It does the job and works well. I can see where people say that it breaks after a while but my son has put some work into this one and I'll just switch it out when it finally goes.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works, does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Great workaround for a lack of return vents. Our home builders laziness/cheap corner-cutting means we have five air conditioner registers without a return that all are trying to vent under our door. That creates so much air pressure that our young kids can’t open the door when the a/c is running. These help both issues.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Baker

customer_reviews.title: They prevent doors closing
customer_reviews.text: They work well to keep doors open so kitties may come and go freely and hopefully never again get locked in a room because my toddler can't resist showing us all how well she can close doors. They also help to prevent pinched fingers. :) Unfortunately, my little one is now rather frustrated with the doors that have suddenly become remarkably stubborn.
customer_reviews.author: ksh

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: These definitely work as far as keeping doors from getting slammed. My toddler likes to do that sometimes, but they have a tendency to split right down the middle so it would be good to have a few to spare in case that happens.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to slip on the door when I don't want my toddler to shut herself in or myself out of a room. It prevents the door from closing on her fingers and doesn't cause the door to bounce back at her if she attempts to slam the door. When I want to close the door I just slip the guard off.
customer_reviews.author: Susan H.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: Whoever invented pinch guards is a genius! They're so simple and they totally do the job of protecting my son's fingers. I highly recommend them to parents of little ones who enjoy opening and closing doors. All pros, zero cons.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Q

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and fulfills our concern for this particular door at our place that is a high risk for our kids. We only needed one but they were cheap so we were happy to get them and gave the rest to our neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Finger saver!
customer_reviews.text: my 11 month old son loved to open and shut doors so this legit is the best thing so his little fingers don't get caught in the door. Iy also is great because now he cant shut the cats im rooms. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Would Like A Smaller Pack
customer_reviews.text: These are a great idea, but I didn't need six of them! It would be nice if they would also be offered as singles or even two would be better than six! I've asked friends if anyone wants some and since I had no takers they are going to Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Mysteri

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: My son is 20 months old and has discovered how to close doors. Which is of course a huge scare for me if I am not watching him. These fit on every door & if you need to take them off they fit perfectly on the doorknob so you dont lose it! I have tried alot of these and they usually tear at the bend. But these are great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: GabyStaas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, works exactly like we needed them to. Provides plenty of space to where baby can’t close the door on his fingers. Also, when you’re not using them, they hook perfectly on the door knob so you can now close the door but they’re right there for when you need them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: Our 11 month old daughter has an obsession with opening and closing doors. These work great to avoid jammed fingers. If you want to completely close the door, take the guard off and it can rest behind the door knob and not fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say here other than they work as advertised. We have cats that get really upset when certain doors get closed and they’ll tear up the carpet. These are now installed on said doors and can be removed and re-added in just a few seconds. Now the spoiled animals will stop destroying my house.
customer_reviews.author: D. Durrett

customer_reviews.title: Great safety feature for little fingers
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived promptly as promised. These are perfect to protect anyone's fingers from getting pinched when closing a door. Very durable, easy to attach, very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and work well
customer_reviews.text: Serve their purpose. I only docked a star because little ones can easily break them apart. I like that they can be used on the side or top of door depending on how open you need it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Jill K

customer_reviews.title: Not just for baby proofing...
customer_reviews.text: We use these throughout the house on windy days when windows are open to keep doors from slamming shut. We also use them on the basement door to remind everyone that the cat may have gone downstairs - preventing her from getting trapped in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyOne

customer_reviews.title: In A Pinch...
customer_reviews.text: These are a must have for any household with very young children or toddlers. They have probably saved my little son countless incidence of finger pinching. They're very easy to use, and they don't damage either the door or the door jamb. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Willie V. HughesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: My kids (7 and 4) had started locking themselves in their rooms to keep others out. I put these at the very top of the door and they’ve saved me from having to reverse the doorknobs. I also don’t miss all the slamming!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine B.

customer_reviews.title: Starting over with baby proofing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these guards because I saw my sister baby proofed her house with them and I thought they were so cool! I have an 8 month old now and kind of starting all over since my last kid is now 11yrs old, so a lot has changed. And these are something new for moms (at least for me) to baby proof. My sisters baby is now 22 months so she’s put them to good use. I’m happy I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: MIA

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great, my boys are rowdy so we place then high up out of reach and they can't shut doors on anyone's hands now.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Jasmin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DOOR STOPS
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that likes to close doors. This works great to keep him from doing that. I know it wasn’t the purpose most people would buy or use these for, but I am grateful for them.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Freehill

customer_reviews.title: Foam
customer_reviews.text: I love these for the price, cheap AF when it comes to quality of you have a child who slams doors as I do. Eventually will rip but for the price you can’t beat it
customer_reviews.author: a pen name

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for those little ones that don't listen to you when you tell them not to play with doors because they're going to get their fingers pinched!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Summers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Door Guards!
customer_reviews.text: These are (so far) working great! We have 1920's wooden doors, and I was a bit worried the guards wouldn't fit, but they fit perfectly. They're easy to put on and take off, which means you can have doors that close (or don't!) whenever you want.
customer_reviews.author: CorriePDX

customer_reviews.title: Out them on top not on the side
customer_reviews.text: I have one year old twins and they like the doors. Was afraid of them pinching at the hinges as well as the handle side. I put them on the top of the door instead of the side and if you butt two of them up to the frame it will keep the door open and they can’t pinch in either end.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Damaged door frame
customer_reviews.text: The product worked as it was intended. However, if you shut the door too hard the pressure will end up stripping the wood where the screws are and now our hinge has come off and won’t screw in. So be aware of that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. It does exactly what I need it to do. It fits snugly in all the doors we have tried and the white color blends in well with our white doors. Getting 6 of this for this price, it is tremendous value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Very strong and sturdy. Doesn't fall off the door like other ones I had before (the ones that looks like animals are garbage!). Also great for chewing if you ask my 10 months old lol Seriously, these are wonderful and amazing quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rotem Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Soft, light-weight, effective
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know I needed these. I purchased when looking for a solution to my kids slamming doors and locking doors. These are easy to slide onto the door to prevent it from closing all the way. My doors are white, so they are not super obvious. They are easy to remove when you want privacy. With months of use, I have never had one of the bumpers come off of the door.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Good in theory.....
customer_reviews.text: These are a great idea and work in theory, however about 6 times of my toddlers trying to slam the door and they bent and broke in half. We went through half the pack on 1 door in just a few days. We are looking for something else online since these just did not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy I purchased
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase. I don’t have to worry about my baby getting her fingers smashed and when she’s napping I don’t have to worry about doors slamming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just What Our Doggies Needed
customer_reviews.text: My young niece has taken to shutting all the doors in the house. This is just what we needed to prevent our doggies from getting shut in rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Serve the purpose.
customer_reviews.text: This door guard serves the purpose for me. I needed to protect a glass door from a refrigerator handle. It makes for a bulky item on the refrigerator door handle, but it is easily removable so it van be placed in position when needed and removed when not.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Love these for my kids
customer_reviews.text: My kids love to shut doors and lock each other in rooms. So these come in handy to prevent that! They stay on the door nice and snug
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: perfect for protecting kids form doors
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly protects kids from closing doors too hard on each other (use case: 4yr old and 1yr old). Easy to install and remove. Stops doors without making any sound. Soft - doesn't damage door or paint even when kids try to swing the door hard. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chandran

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: They work as advertised. Prevents doors from closing and pinching hands. Made from a softer material so they don't make a loud thud when they prevent a door from closing. We leave ours on and rarely remove them, so I haven't experienced the breaking issues others have reported. Looks much better than cut-up pool noodles.
customer_reviews.author: NDRedhead

customer_reviews.title: Work Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I use them to be sure certain doors remain open for my cats so they don't become trapped in a room or locked out of others. Work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Nanette M. Glencer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, broke easily, wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great concept but cheaply made , gets dented easily and 3 already broke one me so it won’t stay in the door. Wish I could get my money back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poor item to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these items for a week now and they do not work well at all on slider doors. They fall off very easily and really is a waste of money. Must try another item so the doors will not close on fingers.
customer_reviews.author: mouse

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Do the trick! Easy to hang on the doorknob when I do want to close the door and durable enough to withstand my infant chewing on them.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Safe baby= money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Just got these today they look well made for what they are..they fit fine without a tear on my door thats (1 and 1/4 inch). Unless your baby has hulk like strength he/she won't have pinched fingers with these stoppers
customer_reviews.author: G.A.Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on the door, definitely keeps the door open and easy to remove when needed. Leaves no marks, very soft material, yet functional.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa A. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these guards for 5 years now. They are the best thing to use on our doors so that my kids do not lock themselves in a room or slam doors.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Drozdowska

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I use these at home and at work to keep doors from closing all of the way. Work great...light to carry in your pocket
customer_reviews.author: cubsrule1988

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Needed a product to keep a door open so nobody has to stand there for long periods of time. This was a great alternative to regular foot door stoppers. Our local fire marshal had us take out all the door stoppers so this was a nice alternative!
customer_reviews.author: ISLAMIC FOUNDATION OF GREATER ST. LOUIS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves to lock the doors, but dislikes unlocking them. After trying to convince her to unlock the door for almost 2 hours, I went on Amazon to find something that would help this from occuring again. With these placed on the doors she can’t even close them now! I’d give it 6 stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu78

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: I feel like you can achieve the same thing by taking a piece of Styrofoam that comes in any package and taping it to the door to save $10. Also gets dirty pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Fu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for those little fingers!!
customer_reviews.text: These are such a necessity if you have younger children! My hopes, is that they come out with a similar product for the INSIDE of the door also! This blocks the door from closing but there is still a little room on the inside of the door to pinch those little fingers
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I use these to keep doors open for my cat. I'm so thoughtful. But really, these are hard to find in stores! Glad I found them online!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for little fingers
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and incredibly helpful, for curious crawling infants! When not in use, you can just put it over the door knob. Based on others, a 6-pack was definitely a good value. Haven't used them for a long time yet, but they seem pretty durable. Overall, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Agnieszka Kozlowska

customer_reviews.title: Very useful product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Door Pinch Guards for when my granddaughter visits. Easy to put on the door, works great to keep her fingers from getting pinched in the door when she closes it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best things ever!!! My kids are constantly slamming their doors and I always get paranoid their little fingers will get caught in the process. These have been amazing and an ease of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Super useful
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on the door. My 2.5 year old son likes to slam the door to try and knock it off and so far, it has yet to slip. Pretty durable considering the use it gets. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Easy fix for babies
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap and perfect for our house. My daughter was always playing with doors and I was terrified shed smash her fingers. These leave about a 2 inch gap so they don't squish their fingers in the doorjam.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: If you have a walking, mischievous baby- you need these
customer_reviews.text: I can not count how many times my son would have broken his hand in his door had it not been for these. I still cringe when he puts his hand in the door frame but nothing happens.
customer_reviews.author: Ahsn

customer_reviews.title: A must need!
customer_reviews.text: Best ever! What a great invention. Stops our toddlers from closing doors and pinching fingers. We have them on every door!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Breaks in half from use
customer_reviews.text: Most of the guards have broken from the foam ripping where it stops the door. I have only been using these for a few weeks. They are meant to stop doors but break from repeated banging.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis P

customer_reviews.title: Durable and good designedly
customer_reviews.text: I can’t imagine my house without these door guards. My kids love to play with doors and without these guards we probably would lose door by now. They are very durable !
customer_reviews.author: DB customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect safety item!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!!!! My daughter loves opening and closing doors and slamming them! This device was made for her. Best part is when you don’t need it on, you just skip it over the door handle and it doesn’t get in the way of use.
customer_reviews.author: JerzeyMike

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: These are easy and reliable. Just what I wanted. Attach and they keep door from closing all the way. To attach..slide on..simple.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nifty
customer_reviews.text: Alright, these are a lot thinner than the ones I used to have but so far they’ve lasted longer already.
customer_reviews.author: Lvlfamily

customer_reviews.title: work very well
customer_reviews.text: These work wonderfully. I don't have children but I have a indoor door that bangs shut. This solved that problem. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Debra

product_meta.title: Door Pinch Guards (6 Pack) Baby Proof Doors Extra Soft Foam, Sleek Design, Child Safety, Baby Safety Finger Protectors by Jool Baby
feature_bullets: Child Safety Door Pinch Guards are made from soft EVA foam, prevents the doors from closing on your curious child, baby, and even pets.
Prevent Injuries, stop doors from slamming & prevent child or pet from getting locked out.
Baby Proof your doors in seconds: Place the Pinch Guard on the side or on top of the door.
Soft EVA foam door stopper to prevent damage to your doors.
